Type.Name: SystemException
Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: is the base class for all exceptions defined by the system.

remarks.para: This class is provided as a means to differentiate between exceptions defined by the system versus exceptions defined by applications. For more information on exceptions defined by applications, see .

para.block: does not provide information as to the cause of the Exception. In most scenarios, instances of this class should not be thrown. In cases where this class is instantiated, a human-readable message describing the error should be passed to the constructor.

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "A system error has occurred." This message takes into account the current system culture.
